keywords: Chocolate chip cookies, Chocolate, Quick & easy, Christmas, Keto-friendly
name: Keto-Friendly Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: Whether you’re cutting carbs, limiting your sugar, or just looking for a new, delicious way to make chocolate chip cookies, this is your recipe. Soft and chewy, these cookies will satisfy even the fiercest sweet craving.
recipeIngredient: 3/4 cup (128g) King Arthur Baking Sugar Alternative*
1/2 teaspoon King Arthur Pure Vanilla Extract
1 cup + 2 tablespoons (135g) King Arthur Keto Wheat Flour
recipeInstructions:
Preheat the oven to 350°F. Lightly grease (or line with parchment) two baking sheets.
, Beat together the butter, baking sugar alternative, baking soda, salt, and vanilla extract until smooth and creamy.
, Add the egg, mixing thoroughly and scraping the bowl afterwards. Stir in the flour, then the chocolate chips and nuts.
, Scoop heaping tablespoonfuls of dough (a level tablespoon cookie scoop works well here) onto the prepared baking sheets, spacing them 2” to 3” apart; you’ll fit about 12 cookies per pan.
, Bake the cookies for 10 to 12 minutes, or until the cookies begin to puff and the edges are just starting to turn golden brown. 
, Remove the cookies from the oven and allow them to cool completely on the pan.
, Store cookies, well wrapped, at room temperature for several days; freeze for longer storage.
